messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Dragon Books
messages.msgSnippet: My dd liked all the Dragonology books and has just finished reading two of  Chris d Lacey s books The Fire Within and Icefire. The third, Fire Star, is next on
messages.messageBody:
My dd liked all the Dragonology books and has just finished reading
two of Chris d'Lacey's books The Fire Within and Icefire. The third,
Fire Star, is next on the list. We haven't seen the fourth yet (The
Fire Eternal) - he's published originally in the UK, so I don't think
it's made its way over here yet. He also has two other books in a new
series (probably not here until next year) called "Dragons of Wayward
Crescent."

As she is into World of Warcraft now, she recently enjoyed "Day of the
Dragon" which features one of her favorite dragons in the game,
Deathwing (she plays in the Disciples of Deathwing guild on Windrunner).

One book that she liked when she was younger (I read it to her) was
Rebecca Rupp's "The Dragon of Lonely Island." I mentioned it to her
today and she said she wants to read it herself now.

Robin B.

messages.subject: Dragon Books
messages.msgSnippet: Here s a partial list from our Dragon shelf: Jeremey Thatcher, Dragon Hatcher  - Bruce Coville Moongobble and Me,  The Dragon of Doom  - Bruce Coville Dragon
messages.messageBody:
Here's a partial list from our Dragon shelf:

Jeremey Thatcher, Dragon Hatcher - Bruce Coville

Moongobble and Me, The Dragon of Doom - Bruce Coville

Dragon Rider - Cornelia Funke (My son high recommends all her books.)

How To Raise and Keep a Dragon - John Topsell

How to Choose Your Dragon - Val & Ron Lindahn

A Book of Dragons - Hosie & Leonard Baskin

Dragonology & it's companion books

Dragonology Chronicals

Dealing with Dragons -Patricia C. Wrede

Icefire - Chris D'Lacey

Eragon -Christopher Paolini

Eldest - Christopher Paolini

;-)
